description: Pipeline for fast, simple processing of BiSulfite-treated reads into methylation data. Includes scripts for analysis and visualization. In addition to a binary output, the direct output of methylcoder is a text file that indicates per-nucleotide methylation context (CG/CHG/CHH) and methylation levels (both coverage and C-T conversions)
name: MethylCoder

metadata.abstract: Motivation: MethylCoder is a software program that generates per-base methylation data given a set of bisulte-treated reads. It provides the option to use either of two existing short-read aligners, each with different strengths. It accounts for soft-masked alignments and overlapping paired-end reads. MethylCoder outputs data in text and binary formats in addition to the nal alignment in SAM format, so that common high-throughput sequencing tools can be used on the resulting output. It is more exible than existing software and competitive in terms of speed and memory use. © The Author 2011. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.
metadata.title: MethylCoder: Software pipeline for bisulte-treated sequences
